messages: 56f07091c174a6a15cdac1bf8c5ab444 (23:16): Can <h2> be in a <p>?
56f07091c174a6a15cdac1bf8c5ab444 (23:16): If so, <p><h2>My fancy subtitle.</h2> Published blah.</p> may be more correct.
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:19): 56f07091c174a6a15cdac1bf8c5ab444: No
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:19): 56f07091c174a6a15cdac1bf8c5ab444: in text/html, the <h2> creates an implied </p>
56f07091c174a6a15cdac1bf8c5ab444 (23:19): Because my current way isn't really Working Out.
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:19): 56f07091c174a6a15cdac1bf8c5ab444: in XHTML, it's non-conforming
56f07091c174a6a15cdac1bf8c5ab444 (23:20): It's making me have to make (header h2, header p) inline.
56f07091c174a6a15cdac1bf8c5ab444 (23:28): Anyone have markupy suggestions?
56f07091c174a6a15cdac1bf8c5ab444 (23:28): I already have a <header> including a <h1> and these two elements..
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:30): 56f07091c174a6a15cdac1bf8c5ab444: what sort of subtitle is it? I'd probably just use a <p> for it
56f07091c174a6a15cdac1bf8c5ab444 (23:30): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: like
56f07091c174a6a15cdac1bf8c5ab444 (23:31): <h1>Killing Gnomes</h1><h2>A great idea with a terrible implementation.</h2><p>Published 1970-01-01.</p>
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:31): 56f07091c174a6a15cdac1bf8c5ab444: I'd just use a p emenet
56f07091c174a6a15cdac1bf8c5ab444 (23:31): which, in the end, I'm trying to display like <p>A great idea with a terrible implementation. Published 1970-01-01.</p>
56f07091c174a6a15cdac1bf8c5ab444 (23:32): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: OK then
56f07091c174a6a15cdac1bf8c5ab444 (23:32): it feels like I should mark a subtitle SOMEHOW, though.
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:33): 56f07091c174a6a15cdac1bf8c5ab444: Heck, if you want that, just a single p element
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:33): 56f07091c174a6a15cdac1bf8c5ab444: a p element is markup! :P
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:33): 56f07091c174a6a15cdac1bf8c5ab444: Also, put the date in a time element
56f07091c174a6a15cdac1bf8c5ab444 (23:33): yes, I am a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:33): wishes that was better supported
57d876083caf517f49e8cf5e03307450 (23:33): that seems to be the desired formatting, FWICT
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:34): I use display: run-in on the print styles for my blog, though only Prince XML and Opera actually manage to render the print style correctly
56f07091c174a6a15cdac1bf8c5ab444 (23:34): I'm all for browser snobbery
56f07091c174a6a15cdac1bf8c5ab444 (23:34): but I'd like to support ff,opera,safari
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:34): Browsers just tend to have rubbish support of print stuff which doesn't help
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:35): 56f07091c174a6a15cdac1bf8c5ab444: display: run-in isn't supported in Gecko, so that won't work
57d876083caf517f49e8cf5e03307450 (23:35): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: patches welcome, I suppose
57d876083caf517f49e8cf5e03307450 (23:36): wonders idly if IE 8 will support run-in
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:36): 57d876083caf517f49e8cf5e03307450: I don't have the interest to write stuff like that for Gecko
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:36): 57d876083caf517f49e8cf5e03307450: It should, IIRC b1 does
56f07091c174a6a15cdac1bf8c5ab444 (23:36): 57d876083caf517f49e8cf5e03307450: that won't be of much interest to me:
56f07091c174a6a15cdac1bf8c5ab444 (23:36): <meta http-equiv='X-UA-Compatible' content='IE=5'>
56f07091c174a6a15cdac1bf8c5ab444 (23:37): (i hope it can emulate that far back ;))
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:37): 56f07091c174a6a15cdac1bf8c5ab444: that just enters quirks mode
56f07091c174a6a15cdac1bf8c5ab444 (23:37): i want full ie 5 emulation
56f07091c174a6a15cdac1bf8c5ab444 (23:37): can I have my money back, microsoft?
56f07091c174a6a15cdac1bf8c5ab444 (23:37): 57d876083caf517f49e8cf5e03307450: see, that's not as fun
56f07091c174a6a15cdac1bf8c5ab444 (23:37): IE 1 would probably just ignore my css
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:37): IE 5.5, IE7 and IE8 are supported
56f07091c174a6a15cdac1bf8c5ab444 (23:37): but ie 5 is just clever enough to really break my page
56f07091c174a6a15cdac1bf8c5ab444 (23:37): ah, 5.5 is close enough
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:37): (IE5.5 is what quirks mode has been ever since)
56f07091c174a6a15cdac1bf8c5ab444 (23:38): oh, really?
56f07091c174a6a15cdac1bf8c5ab444 (23:38): crazy
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:38): But AFAIK it's just supported as switches within the IE7 engine
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:41): 57d876083caf517f49e8cf5e03307450: they're claiming support for IE8 final of display:run-in
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:42): (but that comes just as part of the full CSS 2.1 support inevitably)
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:42): it seems IE8b1 doesn't, though
57d876083caf517f49e8cf5e03307450 (23:42): I guess FF needs to get its run-in going, then
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:44): IE8 should be pretty close to getting the print styles of my blog right, too
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:44): (you need some CSS3 support to get it fully right)
56f07091c174a6a15cdac1bf8c5ab444 (23:45): i think everyone should base their designs on Acid3
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:49): You need CSS 2.1 + CSS 3's Generated Content for Paged Media and Paged Media modules for the print version of my blog :P
56f07091c174a6a15cdac1bf8c5ab444 (00:02): Wow. Link? :P
56f07091c174a6a15cdac1bf8c5ab444 (00:03): is aiming for trivial markup, trivial design with his blog
56f07091c174a6a15cdac1bf8c5ab444 (00:03): so it doesn't really need much
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (00:05): 56f07091c174a6a15cdac1bf8c5ab444: http:/ a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554.com/
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (00:05): 56f07091c174a6a15cdac1bf8c5ab444: It's not conforming HTML 5, I know
56f07091c174a6a15cdac1bf8c5ab444 (00:05): <html lang="en-gb-x 104e556a9fc2be58ac6a7f40cf822e59">
56f07091c174a6a15cdac1bf8c5ab444 (00:05): someone took a leaf out of hixie's book :-P
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (00:06): 56f07091c174a6a15cdac1bf8c5ab444: Oh, never :P
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (00:06): is yet to write a spec for it though
56f07091c174a6a15cdac1bf8c5ab444 (00:06): considers en-gb-x-sdjfklsfjdoijafoidjfkoiakjfoiajfoiawjoaiewudrcioarucawoxpkaiosafjaidfjdslfk
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (00:06): 56f07091c174a6a15cdac1bf8c5ab444: that's non-conforming
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (00:06): 56f07091c174a6a15cdac1bf8c5ab444: each subtag has a max. length of eight characters
56f07091c174a6a15cdac1bf8c5ab444 (00:06): Stop shattering my hopes and dreams.
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (00:07): (I'd be using en-gb-x a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 if I could)
56f07091c174a6a15cdac1bf8c5ab444 (00:07): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: That's what you get for not having an IRC-friendly nickname! Sucks to be you. ;)
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (00:08): 56f07091c174a6a15cdac1bf8c5ab444: How's it not IRC-friendly!?
56f07091c174a6a15cdac1bf8c5ab444 (00:08): IRC nicknames are 7 or less characters. :-P
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (00:08): is happy to have a 7-letter surname
56f07091c174a6a15cdac1bf8c5ab444 (00:08): I have a three letter surname, but I don't like it. :p
56f07091c174a6a15cdac1bf8c5ab444 (00:09): 104e556a9fc2be58ac6a7f40cf822e59: Now you get extra unicorns in your daily servings.
104e556a9fc2be58ac6a7f40cf822e59 (00:10): I so have to write a blog post in response to the fact that someone found my blog searching for "claiming a love"
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (00:10): 56f07091c174a6a15cdac1bf8c5ab444, in which clients are IRC nicknames limited to 7 characters?
56f07091c174a6a15cdac1bf8c5ab444 (00:10): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: It's just common convention.
56f07091c174a6a15cdac1bf8c5ab444 (00:10): I mean, not as a hard limit, but what I'd class as an "IRC nickname"

56f07091c174a6a15cdac1bf8c5ab444 (00:12): wonders if his blog needs a little more debris than "Here are the latest entries in my blog. If you like, you can see a list of older ones too." and "Licensed under CC by-sa."
104e556a9fc2be58ac6a7f40cf822e59 (00:13): (fwiw, I started to write a blog post about last May)
56f07091c174a6a15cdac1bf8c5ab444 (00:14): 104e556a9fc2be58ac6a7f40cf822e59: your url design is mine!
56f07091c174a6a15cdac1bf8c5ab444 (00:14): (/slug and nothing more)
56f07091c174a6a15cdac1bf8c5ab444 (00:14): technically I have some extra stuff
56f07091c174a6a15cdac1bf8c5ab444 (00:14): though most of that is redirects so I can be pedantic
104e556a9fc2be58ac6a7f40cf822e59 (00:14): 56f07091c174a6a15cdac1bf8c5ab444: Habari has no easy way to change it :P
56f07091c174a6a15cdac1bf8c5ab444 (00:14): e.g. /slug/comments redirects to /slug#comments
56f07091c174a6a15cdac1bf8c5ab444 (00:15): so that the comment form can PUT to /slug/comments
56f07091c174a6a15cdac1bf8c5ab444 (00:15): and /slug/comments/N redirects to /slug#comment-N
56f07091c174a6a15cdac1bf8c5ab444 (00:15): so that my baleet button can DELETE to /slug/comments/N
56f07091c174a6a15cdac1bf8c5ab444 (00:15): oh, and I won't be able to use "login" or "post" as a slug
56f07091c174a6a15cdac1bf8c5ab444 (00:15): that's about it I think
56f07091c174a6a15cdac1bf8c5ab444 (00:16): oh, and /slug/edit shows my edit form
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (00:16): /atom, /tag, /user, and /admin are forbidden off the top of my head
56f07091c174a6a15cdac1bf8c5ab444 (00:17): ah, my atom will be /index.html or /index.atom
56f07091c174a6a15cdac1bf8c5ab444 (00:17): or, you know, /
56f07091c174a6a15cdac1bf8c5ab444 (00:17): content negotiation ;)
56f07091c174a6a15cdac1bf8c5ab444 (00:17): oh, /archives
56f07091c174a6a15cdac1bf8c5ab444 (00:17): that's it
56f07091c174a6a15cdac1bf8c5ab444 (00:17): (i don't have tags or anything because they don't really bother me)
56f07091c174a6a15cdac1bf8c5ab444 (00:17): */archive actually
56f07091c174a6a15cdac1bf8c5ab444 (00:17): and /archive is just a semi-pretty list of every post ever
56f07091c174a6a15cdac1bf8c5ab444 (00:18): simplistic :p
56f07091c174a6a15cdac1bf8c5ab444 (00:19): oh, and on a markupy note, universal edit button is so broken
56f07091c174a6a15cdac1bf8c5ab444 (00:19): rel="alternate" type="application/x-wiki"?
56f07091c174a6a15cdac1bf8c5ab444 (00:20): an edit page is not in any way an alternate version of a document and it won't give you back an application/x-wiki page either...
56f07091c174a6a15cdac1bf8c5ab444 (00:20): they could have, you know, just done rel="edit"
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (00:22): Anyone want to bully me into going to a specific uni?
